articles.description: Follow live text commentary, score updates and match stats from Brighton & Hove Albion vs Manchester City in the English Premier League
articles.title: Premier League LIVE: Score updates & text commentary from Brighton  vs Manchester City

articles.description: Red Bull design chief Adrian Newey is to leave the team in the wake of the controversy involving allegations about team principal Christian Horner.
articles.title: Adrian Newey: Red Bull design chief to leave team

articles.description: Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk questions his side's desire to win the Premier League after a damaging defeat against Merseyside rivals Everton.
articles.title: Everton 2-0 Liverpool: Virgil van Dijk questions team's desire

articles.description: England make two injury-enforced changes to face France in their Grand Slam decider on Saturday in Bordeaux.
articles.title: Women's Six Nations 2024: England hooker Amy Cokayne returns

articles.description: Fifa has announced a partnership with Saudi Arabia's state-owned oil company, Aramco.
articles.title: Fifa: Saudi oil firm Aramco to sponsor men's & women's World Cups

articles.description: The World Anti-Doping Agency launches an independent review after 23 Chinese swimmers were cleared to compete at Tokyo 2020 despite failing drug tests.
articles.title: Tokyo 2020: Wada launches review into China swimming failed tests

articles.description: Rafael Nadal begins his Madrid Open farewell with a comfortable straight-set win over American teenager Darwin Blanch.
articles.title: Madrid Open: Rafael Nadal begins farewell with straight-set win

articles.description: Seven-time champion Ronnie O'Sullivan says he is capable of winning a world title in his 50s after reaching the last 16 at the 2024 event.
articles.title: Ronnie O'Sullivan says he can win World Championship in his 50s

articles.description: The Spanish government will oversee the country's football federation until it holds new elections following the Luis Rubiales scandal.
articles.title: Spanish government to oversee football federation after Luis Rubiales scandal

articles.description: West Ham striker Antonio responds to Roy Keane's criticism of current players who speak on podcasts, calling it a 'dinosaur mentality'
articles.title: Roy Keane criticism 'dinosaur mentality' - West Ham's Michail Antonio
